title.narrative: Feasibility Study - 450 MW of Gas-Fired Generation at Kelvin Power Station, through EHS Support LLC

description.narrative: A USTDA grant is partially funding a feasibility study to assess the viability of a combined-cycle gas power plant of up to 450 megawatts and associated natural gas infrastructure at the existing Kelvin Power Station near Johannesburg in Gauteng Province, South Africa. The Project is expected to serve as an anchor for gas demand in Gauteng Province; therefore, successful implementation may lead to the upgrading of at least four other coal-fired power plants in Gauteng Province to convert to gas.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - 450 MW of Gas-Fired Generation at Kelvin Power Station, through EHS Support LLC

description.narrative: A USTDA grant is partially funding a feasibility study to assess the viability of a combined-cycle gas power plant of up to 450 megawatts and associated natural gas infrastructure at the existing Kelvin Power Station near Johannesburg in Gauteng Province, South Africa. The Project is expected to serve as an anchor for gas demand in Gauteng Province; therefore, successful implementation may lead to the upgrading of at least four other coal-fired power plants in Gauteng Province to convert to gas. The Grantee is NOVO Energy (Pty) Ltd (Grantee) and the U.S. firm EHS Support. LLC of Pittsburgh, PA will be undertaking the feasibility study.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Cybersecurity and Data Protection Solutions, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will familiarize public and/or private sector representatives from South Africa with the latest U.S. technologies, services, and best practices in cybersecurity and data protection solutions. The RTM will include meetings with U.S. industry representatives, associations, financial institutions, and U.S. government agencies.

title.narrative: Coalbed Methane Development in Waterberg Coalfield, through Advanced Resources International, Inc.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Anglo Operations Ltd funds a feasibility study to develop and commercialize a coalbed methane ("CBM") site in South Africa. This feasibility study will help Anglo Operations Ltd determine the viability of developing this CBM asset, help decide how to commercialize the asset, reduce gas shortages, and diversify South Africa's domestic energy resources while promoting U.S. export of goods and services. The U.S. firm, Advanced Resources International, Inc., is completing the study on a sole-source basis.

title.narrative: TV White Space Wi-Fi Rural Connectivity, through Adaptrum, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study in the form of a pilot project (Pilot) that would test the viability of television white space (TVWS) networks at three sites in South Africa, as well as produce a business plan, a financing plan, and a white paper. These documents would be used to promote the development of multiple TVWS networks across South Africa among members of The Wireless Access Providers' Association, which is the grantee.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - South African Health Products Regulatory Authority Reliance-Based Protocols for Healthcare Products Technical Assistance, through Boston Consulting Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant to the South African Health Products Regulatory Authority (SAHPRA) provides funding for technical assistance that would increase the efficiency of pharmaceutical, medical device, and in vitro diagnostic (IVD) product registrations and approvals in South Africa. title.narrative: South Africa Clean Energy and Climate Infrastructure Event Series, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: This funding is supporting the South Africa Clean Energy and Climate Infrastructure Event Series consisting of two Reverse Trade Missions (RTMs) and two workshops. The Event Series will promote cooperation on clean energy and climate projects between the public and private sectors in the United States (U.S.) and South Africa and aim to further the likelihood that climate projects in South Africa are implemented utilizing U.S. goods and services. This funding is being added to the South Africa: Clean Energy and Climate Infrastructure Event Series.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Western Cape Province Broadband Expansion, through Global Resources, Inc.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Western Cape Government (WCG) funds a feasibility study that will assess the economic and technical viability of deploying fiber and fixed wireless infrastructure to expand broadband internet in the Western Cape province of South Africa. The Study will also assist the WCG to assess ownership and operations models for future broadband deployments. U.S. firm Global Resources, Inc. (Irvine, CA) will carry out the Study on a solesource basis.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Affordable Off-Grid Connectivity Feasibility Study, through Vernonburg Group LLC

description.narrative: A USTDA grant funds a feasibility study (Study) to assess the economic and technical viability of Ilitha Telecommunications (Pty) Ltd's expansion of fixed wireless access network infrastructure in township communities with unreliable electricity access across South Africa. The Study would include a pilot of U.S. company MeshPlusPlus Inc.'s solar-powered Wi-Fi solution in Mandela Park, a township in the O.R. Tambo District of the Eastern Cape Province. U.S. firm Vernonburg Group LLC will carry out the Study on a sole-source basis.

Tambo (Johannesburg) international airports in South Africa. Increasing the airside capacity of South Africa's principal international airports will promote regional integration, aviation safety, and economic growth.

description.narrative: This desk study reviewed a cost-shared proposal for a Solar Park Training Program Technical Assistance program for the Municipality of Siyathemba, located in Northern Cape, South Africa. The Program would provide occupational skill development and project management training to support local employment and ownership of competitive subcontracting firms that are needed for implementation of a 1 gigawatt solar energy and industrial park development as part of South Africa's Solar Corridor Initiative.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Airside Capacity Enhancements, through Montgomery Consulting Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This desk study reviewed and assessed the value of work completed pursuant to the Terms of Reference of the South Africa: Airside Capacity Enhancements Feasibility Study (FS) (USTDA No. 2012-11001A). The objective of the FS was to identify and validate existing capacity enhancing technologies and procedural improvements that lead to reduced delays and increased efficiency and safety of air traffic movements at three of South Africa's main airports: Cape Town, King Shaka (Durban), and O.R. Tambo (Johannesburg) international airports.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Ekurhuleni Smart Metering, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: This $695,000 grant to the Ekurhuleni Metropolitan Municipality (EMM) supported a feasibility study to evaluate the technical, financial, environmental, and other critical aspects of implementing advanced metering infrastructure in Ekurhuleni, South Africa. The study included the development of a smart metering implementation roadmap and the design of a smart metering pilot project. The implementation of advanced metering infrastructure in Ekurhuleni will promote increased energy savings for consumers while at the same time improving EMMs operational efficiency, customer service, and electricity supply optimization.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Ibhubesi Offshore Gas Subsurface Field Development Plan, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: This $700,000 grant to Sunbird Energy Ltd (South Africa) is supporting a Subsurface Field Development Plan for the Ibhubesi Offshore Gas Project. The Subsurface Field Development Plan will be integrated with a Full Field Development Plan being commissioned by Sunbird Energy to define the project engineering requirements and complete an environmental impact assessment and commercial analysis for the development of proven natural gas reserves located off the western coast of South Africa. The study includes construction of a detailed 3D gas reservoir model, assessment of production flow rates, identification of preferred drilling locations, and well design to maximize production against cost and integration with the facilities development plan. The introduction of natural gas from Ibhubesi will help to alleviate South Africa's energy shortage, increase diversity and security of the energy supply, and mitigate carbon emissions by displacing current diesel and coal power generation in the Western Cape Province. The study is being completed with MHA Petroleum Consultants LLC.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Meerkat 18 Megawatt Small Hydropower Project, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Basil Read Energy (Pty) Ltd. is supporting a feasibility study to evaluate the technical, financial, and other aspects of the 18 Megawatt (MW) Run-of-the-River Hydropower Plant in South Africas Northern Cape Province. Implementation of the proposed hydropower plant would add 18 MW of generation capacity, thereby helping to diversify South Africa's energy mix and reduce environmental emissions associated with fossil fuel power sources. Basil Read intends to submit a bid for the Meerkat plants in the fifth round of South Africa's Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement Program. This activity is eligible for financing under the U.S.-Africa Clean Energy Finance Initiative.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - U.S.-ACEF Solafrica 100 MW CSP Plant, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: This $800,000 grant supports a feasibility study for Solafrica Energy (Pty) Ltd. of South Africa to evaluate the technical, financial, and other aspects of a proposed 100 megawatt (MW) concentrated solar power (CSP) plant in South Africas Northern Cape province. The project is expected to result in the construction of a 100 MW CSP plant, and is expected to provide human capacity building through the creation of low-, medium-, and highly skilled jobs as well as provide significant positive environmental impacts and climate change mitigation through the reduction of CO2 emission generation. The project development team intends to invest in the project and seek financing from the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC).

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - U.S.-ACEF Fuel Cell Applications for Telecommunications Tower, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: A USTDA grant of $872,000 to South Africa telecommunications infrastructure solutions provider Plessey (Pty) Ltd. (Grantee) is supporting a feasibility study and pilot project to qualify methanol fuel cell technology for use by the telecommunications industry in South Africa. If implemented, the fuel cell systems would replace diesel fuel generators as the primary or secondary power supply at remote telecommunications tower sites. The developmental impacts of displacing diesel generators with fuel cells would include improvement of South Africa's physical telecommunications infrastructure and operational efficiency, reduction of carbon dioxide emissions and noise pollution, and job creation and technical training for Plessey's South African staff. The feasibility study and pilot project are being undertaken on a sole-source basis by Oorja Protonics, Inc. (Contractor), a direct methanol fuel cell manufacturer based in Fremont, CA. The Contractor has agreed to share costs of the study.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Western Cape Government Solar PV Project, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: This $545,000 grant to the Western Cape Provinces Department of Public Works is supporting a study to evaluate the technical and financial feasibility of implementing a large-scale rooftop photovoltaic project. The study includes a review of South Africas solar irradiation, the Western Cape electricity market, and solar photovoltaic technologies. The study also includes the development of a conceptual plant design for the project, including a detailed cost estimate; environmental, social, and legal assessments; and tender document preparation. The project will promote clean energy solutions while reducing electricity bills for the province.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Renewable Energy Grid Integration, through Business Council for International Understanding

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Khayelitsha And Mitchells Plain Digital Inclusion, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: This $315,000 feasibility study grant supported an evaluation of the technical, financial, and other critical aspects of extending Cape Town's municipal optic fiber backbone to and implementing a Wi-Fi network in two of the municipality's townships, Khayelitsha and Mitchells Plain. title.narrative: Training - U.S.-South Africa Aviation Training Program Phase I, through American Association of Airport Executives

description.narrative: This series of seven separate and distinct aviation sector training activities supports the growth of safe, reliable aviation services in South Africa through the development of critical human capacity resources and closer professional and commercial partnerships between the U.S. and South African aviation sectors.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - KHANYA CONSORTIUM BID SUBMISSION, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: USTDA approved funding in the amount of $550,900 to fund Technical Assistance on behalf of the Black Economic Empowerment (BEE) company, Tiso Energy, in support of a bid submission for the construction and operation of two oil- fired open cycle gas turbine peaking power plants located in the Eastern Cape and KwaZulu Natal Provinces in South Africa. AES provided the Technical Assistance for the preparation of the bid submission. The project would improve the reserve margins of electricity in South Africa in anticipation of expected shortages.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - SOUTH AFRICA: FEASIBILITY STUDY ETHEKWINI METERING, through Government of South Africa

description.narrative: This $446,500 feasibility study grant funds an evaluation of the technical, financial, environmental, and other critical aspects of implementing a smart metering system in eThekwini, South Africa. The use of smart meters will enable time-of-use electricity tariffs, which will encourage consumers to reduce usage during peak demand times.

title.narrative: Natural Gas Project Planning Advisory Services, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: This project planning advisory services activity is to support the Government of South Africa's plans to procure more than 3 gigawatts of gas-fired power from independent power producers and the participation of U.S. companies in South Africa's natural gas sector. The implementation of gas-fired power projects will increase access to affordable, reliable electricity while reducing emissions of carbon dioxide and other pollutants associated with electricity generation in South Africa.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Waste Gas-To-Ethanol Conversion, through LanzaTech, Inc.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Waste Gas-to-Ethanol Conversion, through LanzaTech, Inc.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant is partially funding a feasibility study to assess the technical and economic viability of implementing a proprietary gas fermentation process to convert waste gases into industrial-grade ethanol at a ferrochrome production plant near Middleburg in the South African province of Mpumalanga (Project). The Grantee is Swayana (Pty) Ltd, a project developer based in Johannesburg, South Africa. The Study is being undertaken by LanzaTech, Inc. of Sokokie, IL. The results of the Study will help attract additional investment to the Project and support the scale-up of this U.S. technology in South Africa.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Western Cape Integrated Liquefied Natural Gas (Lng) Importation And Gas-To-Power Project, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: Western Cape Integrated LNG Importation and Gas-to-Power Project Feasibility Study

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Western Cape Integrated Liquefied Natural Gas (Lng) Importation And Gas-To-Power Project, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study that evaluates the market demand, socio-economic impacts and other critical aspects of a proposed integrated liquefied natural gas (LNG) importation and gas-to-power project in the Western Cape Province of South Africa (Project). The Project is expected to add 1,000 MW of new gas-to-power electricity generation capacity, as well as new LNG importation, transmission and storage infrastructure, representing significant U.S. export potential for the equipment, services and LNG supply required for the Project.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: 75 MW Solar Photovoltaic (PV) Power Plant in Free State Province, through Castalia LLC

description.narrative: A USTDA grant in support of Pele Green Energy (Pty) Ltd (Grantee) to fund a feasibility study (Study) to assess the technical, financial and economic viability of a 75 megawatt solar photovoltaic power plant near the town of Luckhoff in the Free State province of South Africa (Project). The U.S. firm Castalia LLC will perform the Study. The Study will provide the Grantee with the necessary technical, financial, and commercial analyses required for preparing a competitive proposal in response to Round 5 of South Africa's Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement Programme. The Study will also assess options for the Project to sell its output directly to interested municipalities, private sector industries or a bulk energy trader.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - ICT Investment Analysis, through Global Resources, Inc.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: ICT Investment Analysis, through Global Resources, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study of the potential, impact, and viability of the City of Cape Town investments in five information and communication technology (ICT) areas: (1) enabling infrastructure; (2) intelligent transportation systems; (3) safety and security; (4) digital inclusion infrastructure; and (5) digital literacy. The feasibility study supports exports of U.S. goods and services for priority ICT and smart city projects that will increase access to affordable, reliable telecommunication services and improve the efficiency and quality of municipal services in Cape Town, South Africa. This grant amendment funds phase II (Tasks 17-30) of the feasibility study project to evaluate the potential, impact, and viability of key information and communications technology investments for the City of Cape Town Municipality. Phase II of the feasibility study would assess the potential, impact, and viability of, as well as develop a framework for, the deployment of a citywide low-power wireless access network using long-range data transmission technology to improve the City of Cape Town's data collection and monitoring capabilities for its water distribution system.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: ICT Investment Analysis, through Global Resources, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study of the potential, impact, and viability of the City of Cape Town investments in five information and communication technology (ICT) areas: (1) enabling infrastructure; (2) intelligent transportation systems; (3) safety and security; (4) digital inclusion infrastructure; and (5) digital literacy. The feasibility study supports exports of U.S. goods and services for priority ICT and smart city projects that will increase access to affordable, reliable telecommunication services and improve the efficiency and quality of municipal services in Cape Town, South Africa. This grant amendment funds phase II (Tasks 17-30) of the feasibility study project to evaluate the potential, impact, and viability of key information and communications technology investments for the City of Cape Town Municipality.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - AIRSIDE CAPACITY ENHANCEMENTS, through Government of South Africa

Tambo (Johannesburg) international airports in South Africa. Increasing the airside capacity of South Africa's principle international airports will promote regional integration, aviation safety, and economic growth.
